intro: Stackhousia pulvinaris var. typica, commonly known as the narrow-leafed stackhousia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the tips of the branches. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in shrubland or open woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
